body_html:
(putting some data here to keep notes) python3 ./tensorflow/examples/tutorials/layers/cnn_mnist.py <Eigen::internal::gemm_pack_lhs<float, long, Eigen::internal::TensorContractionSubMapper<float, long, 1, Eigen::TensorEvaluator<Eigen::TensorReshapingOp<Eigen::DSizes<long, 2> const, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<float const, 4, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer> const> const, Eigen::ThreadPoolDevice>, Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, 16, true, false, 0, Eigen::MakePointer>, 48, 16, 0, false, false>::operator()(float*, Eigen::internal::TensorContractionSubMapper<float, long, 1, Eigen::TensorEvaluator<Eigen::TensorReshapingOp<Eigen::DSizes<long, 2> const, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<float const, 4, 1, long>, 16, Eigen::MakePointer> const> const, Eigen::ThreadPoolDevice>, Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, 16, true, false, 0, Eigen::MakePointer> const&, long, long, long, long)+414> 0x00007fffcc11eea5 <+341>: lea 0x10(%r9),%rbx 0x00007fffcc11eea9 <+345>: lea (%rsi,%r12,4),%r10 0x00007fffcc11eead <+349>: xor %edx,%edx 0x00007fffcc11eeaf <+351>: nop 0x00007fffcc11eeb0 <+352>: mov 0x18(%rdi),%rax 0x00007fffcc11eeb4 <+356>: mov (%rdi),%r11 0x00007fffcc11eeb7 <+359>: sub $0xffffffffffffff80,%r10 0x00007fffcc11eebb <+363>: imul %rdx,%rax 0x00007fffcc11eebf <+367>: add $0x1,%rdx 0x00007fffcc11eec3 <+371>: lea (%rax,%r9,1),%r15 0x00007fffcc11eec7 <+375>: add %rbx,%rax 0x00007fffcc11eeca <+378>: vmovups (%r11,%r15,4),%zmm1 0x00007fffcc11eed1 <+385>: vmovups (%r11,%rax,4),%zmm0 => 0x00007fffcc11eed8 <+392>: vmovaps %zmm1,-0x80(%r10) 0x00007fffcc11eedf <+399>: vmovaps %zmm0,-0x40(%r10) (gdb) display /x $r10 3: /x $r10 = 0x7fff3c009720 the memory is not aligned to 64 bytes, but only to 32 bytes.. doing an avx512 vmovaps then will fault on this misalignment. next step, tracing down where that memory got allocated On Wed, Dec 20, 2017 at 5:39 PM, Arjan van de Ven <arjanvandeven@gmail.com> wrote:
…
I have not had enough time to dig through all the math to find where it miscomputes... it's on my (long) todo list though On Wed, Dec 20, 2017 at 1:49 PM, drpngx ***@***.***> wrote: > That's not good. Are you in a position to send out a fix? > > — > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <#7116 (comment)>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABPeFfxeEqVJuVbKZvtOk3JZMERsgJK6ks5tCYEAgaJpZM4LwOOY> > . >
body_text:
(putting some data here to keep notes)

 python3 ./tensorflow/examples/tutorials/layers/cnn_mnist.py


 <Eigen::internal::gemm_pack_lhs<float, long,
Eigen::internal::TensorContractionSubMapper<float, long, 1,
Eigen::TensorEvaluator<Eigen::TensorReshapingOp<Eigen::DSizes<long, 2>
const, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<float const, 4, 1, long>, 16,
Eigen::MakePointer> const> const, Eigen::ThreadPoolDevice>,
Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, 16, true, false, 0,
Eigen::MakePointer>, 48, 16, 0, false, false>::operator()(float*,
Eigen::internal::TensorContractionSubMapper<float, long, 1,
Eigen::TensorEvaluator<Eigen::TensorReshapingOp<Eigen::DSizes<long, 2>
const, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<float const, 4, 1, long>, 16,
Eigen::MakePointer> const> const, Eigen::ThreadPoolDevice>,
Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, 16, true, false, 0,
Eigen::MakePointer> const&, long, long, long, long)+414>
   0x00007fffcc11eea5 <+341>:   lea    0x10(%r9),%rbx
   0x00007fffcc11eea9 <+345>:   lea    (%rsi,%r12,4),%r10
   0x00007fffcc11eead <+349>:   xor    %edx,%edx
   0x00007fffcc11eeaf <+351>:   nop
   0x00007fffcc11eeb0 <+352>:   mov    0x18(%rdi),%rax
   0x00007fffcc11eeb4 <+356>:   mov    (%rdi),%r11
   0x00007fffcc11eeb7 <+359>:   sub    $0xffffffffffffff80,%r10
   0x00007fffcc11eebb <+363>:   imul   %rdx,%rax
   0x00007fffcc11eebf <+367>:   add    $0x1,%rdx
   0x00007fffcc11eec3 <+371>:   lea    (%rax,%r9,1),%r15
   0x00007fffcc11eec7 <+375>:   add    %rbx,%rax
   0x00007fffcc11eeca <+378>:   vmovups (%r11,%r15,4),%zmm1
   0x00007fffcc11eed1 <+385>:   vmovups (%r11,%rax,4),%zmm0
=> 0x00007fffcc11eed8 <+392>:   vmovaps %zmm1,-0x80(%r10)
   0x00007fffcc11eedf <+399>:   vmovaps %zmm0,-0x40(%r10)


(gdb) display /x $r10
3: /x $r10 = 0x7fff3c009720


the memory is not aligned to 64 bytes, but only to 32 bytes.. doing an
avx512 vmovaps then will fault on this misalignment.

next step, tracing down where that memory got allocated

On Wed, Dec 20, 2017 at 5:39 PM, Arjan van de Ven <arjanvandeven@gmail.com>
wrote:
…
 I have not had enough time to dig through all the math to find where it
 miscomputes... it's on my (long) todo list though

 On Wed, Dec 20, 2017 at 1:49 PM, drpngx ***@***.***> wrote:

> That's not good. Are you in a position to send out a fix?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <#7116 (comment)>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABPeFfxeEqVJuVbKZvtOk3JZMERsgJK6ks5tCYEAgaJpZM4LwOOY>
> .
>
body:
(putting some data here to keep notes)

 python3 ./tensorflow/examples/tutorials/layers/cnn_mnist.py


 <Eigen::internal::gemm_pack_lhs<float, long,
Eigen::internal::TensorContractionSubMapper<float, long, 1,
Eigen::TensorEvaluator<Eigen::TensorReshapingOp<Eigen::DSizes<long, 2>
const, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<float const, 4, 1, long>, 16,
Eigen::MakePointer> const> const, Eigen::ThreadPoolDevice>,
Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, 16, true, false, 0,
Eigen::MakePointer>, 48, 16, 0, false, false>::operator()(float*,
Eigen::internal::TensorContractionSubMapper<float, long, 1,
Eigen::TensorEvaluator<Eigen::TensorReshapingOp<Eigen::DSizes<long, 2>
const, Eigen::TensorMap<Eigen::Tensor<float const, 4, 1, long>, 16,
Eigen::MakePointer> const> const, Eigen::ThreadPoolDevice>,
Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, Eigen::array<long, 1ul>, 16, true, false, 0,
Eigen::MakePointer> const&, long, long, long, long)+414>
   0x00007fffcc11eea5 <+341>:   lea    0x10(%r9),%rbx
   0x00007fffcc11eea9 <+345>:   lea    (%rsi,%r12,4),%r10
   0x00007fffcc11eead <+349>:   xor    %edx,%edx
   0x00007fffcc11eeaf <+351>:   nop
   0x00007fffcc11eeb0 <+352>:   mov    0x18(%rdi),%rax
   0x00007fffcc11eeb4 <+356>:   mov    (%rdi),%r11
   0x00007fffcc11eeb7 <+359>:   sub    $0xffffffffffffff80,%r10
   0x00007fffcc11eebb <+363>:   imul   %rdx,%rax
   0x00007fffcc11eebf <+367>:   add    $0x1,%rdx
   0x00007fffcc11eec3 <+371>:   lea    (%rax,%r9,1),%r15
   0x00007fffcc11eec7 <+375>:   add    %rbx,%rax
   0x00007fffcc11eeca <+378>:   vmovups (%r11,%r15,4),%zmm1
   0x00007fffcc11eed1 <+385>:   vmovups (%r11,%rax,4),%zmm0
=> 0x00007fffcc11eed8 <+392>:   vmovaps %zmm1,-0x80(%r10)
   0x00007fffcc11eedf <+399>:   vmovaps %zmm0,-0x40(%r10)


(gdb) display /x $r10
3: /x $r10 = 0x7fff3c009720


the memory is not aligned to 64 bytes, but only to 32 bytes.. doing an
avx512 vmovaps then will fault on this misalignment.

next step, tracing down where that memory got allocated
